title: 美國入境處: 如果美國既學校下個學期繼續online, 其留學生必須離開美國或者轉校

replies.msg:
簡而言之

1. 如果美國學校全面網上教學, 咁樣所有持F-1,M-1 簽證既留學生必須
(A) 離開美國, 或
(B) 轉去有面對面教學既學校
2. 如果學校係全面面對面教學, 咁樣留學生最多只可以讀一科3 credit既科
3. 如果學校想混合教學, 咁必須向ICE申請, 而且需注明響留學生既I20上面佢地既課程並唔係全部面對面教學


梳屎:
https://www.ice.gov/news/releases/sevp-modifies-temporary-exemptions-nonimmigrant-students-taking-online-courses-during
咁都得
金翅仆街鳥

#HKGestapo

移民局今天在官網上發佈了一個新的通知，是針對2020年秋季學期百分百進行線上課程的學生的。SEVP (The Student and Exchange Visitor Program) 週一宣佈以下條例：

1. 持 F-1 或 M-1 簽證的學生，如果秋季學期完全是線上課程：對於尚未進入美國的學生來說，美國不會簽發新簽證，海關和邊境保護局也不會讓這些學生進入美國；目前人在美國的學生，如果秋季學期是這樣的狀況則必須離開美國，或採取其他的措施，例如轉到一個有線下課程的學校或者有合理的醫療方面的理由。如有違反，學生將可能面臨不好的後果，其中包括被遣送回國。

2. 那些秋季學期是線下課程為主的學校，學生不受上述條例的限制，學生的移民狀態還是遵照目前聯邦的規定。但在這種情況下持 F 簽證的學生秋季學期最都可以有一節網上課程或者是3個學時的網上課程。

3. 如果持 F-1 簽證的學生上的是線上線下混合模式的學校，這些學生可以上超過一節或是3個學時的哦網上課程；但這些學校必須要向 SEVP 進行報備認證，證明秋季學期不完全是線上課程，並且符合學業要求。

目前編編收到的消息是，例如 CalPolyPomona 2020秋季學期就是用的完全線上課程的方式。

很同情這屆留學生，回國這麼麻煩，現在美國可能也不讓待，但編編和同事討論了一下覺得學校如果為自己的學生著想的話，如果本來是 pure online，就改成混合模式不就好了嗎？還是說，其實混合模式也要滿足很多條件？

來自大陸Forum

一直在想這個政策的動機是什麼，能benefit誰，因為疫情加重而延續一下人道主義的政策本來並不會動誰的蛋糕。看了很多twitter美國網友評論，有的評價就是純粹的Xenophobia，有的人說是因為秋季大選有些搖擺州的選民人口，有沒有college students差別很大(比如假設大學多設在藍州，那麼正常情況下年輕的college students本來就偏democrat，在藍州投票也沒差，但是現在疫情被困在了老家，偏偏是紅州或者搖擺州，那麼大選時會導致搖擺州翻藍）。不知道這個推論是否靠譜，但是結合川普狂躁的tweet https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1280209946085339136，我覺得有點意思。

Schools should update their information in the Student and Exchange Visitor Information System (SEVIS) within 10 days of the change if they begin the fall semester with in-person classes but are later required to switch to only online classes, or a nonimmigrant student changes their course selections, and as a result, ends up taking an entirely online course load. Nonimmigrant students within the United States are not permitted to take a full course of study through online classes. If students find themselves in this situation, they must leave the country or take alternative steps to maintain their nonimmigrant status such as a reduced course load or appropriate medical leave.

簡而言之

1. 如果美國學校全面網上教學, 咁樣所有持F-1,M-1 簽證既留學生必須
(A) 離開美國, 或
(B) 轉去有面對面教學既學校
2. 如果學校係全面面對面教學, 咁樣留學生最多只可以讀一科3 credit既科

URGENT: Are you a Hong Kong foreign student in the US?

This morning, US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) announced it has modified the temporary exemptions for nonimmigrant students taking online courses during the fall 2020 semester.

https://www.ice.gov/…/sevp-modifies-temporary-exemptions-no…

HKDC - Hong Kong Democracy Council US is monitoring closely how and if this temporary rule will be implemented. We are in close contact with federal and state officials, as well as universities and colleges to discuss potential harm and negative impact to students and schools and how we can work together to ensure no student will be forced to abandon their academic pursuits in the US or be forced to travel back home during a global pandemic.

Support our work: www.gogetfunding.com/hkdc

If you are a foreign student from Hong Kong and you are concerned about how this change might impact you or know someone who could be impacted, please email students@hkdc.us with your name, email and phone number, and university/college you are attending.

HKDC - Hong Kong Democracy Council US will be hosting online informational sessions in the coming days to try to answer your questions and to share about steps you can take individually and collectively to ensure that no one is forced to leave the US because of the pandemic.

We stand with US-Hong Kong students

https://www.facebook.com/105804624116745/posts/301858954511310/?d=n

quote.msg:
來自大陸Forum

一直在想這個政策的動機是什麼，能benefit誰，因為疫情加重而延續一下人道主義的政策本來並不會動誰的蛋糕。看了很多twitter美國網友評論，有的評價就是純粹的Xenophobia，有的人說是因為秋季大選有些搖擺州的選民人口，有沒有college students差別很大(比如假設大學多設在藍州，那麼正常情況下年輕的college students本來就偏democrat，在藍州投票也沒差，但是現在疫情被困在了老家，偏偏是紅州或者搖擺州，那麼大選時會導致搖擺州翻藍）。不知道這個推論是否靠譜，但是結合川普狂躁的tweet https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1280209946085339136，我覺得有點意思。

replies.msg: 所以話大陸人ON9, 依家講緊international留學生program, 關college students選票咩事, 留學生又冇份投
不意外 federal依家立場係要一切回復正常

pinned.msg:
URGENT: Are you a Hong Kong foreign student in the US?

This morning, US Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) announced it has modified the temporary exemptions for nonimmigrant students taking online courses during the fall 2020 semester.

https://www.ice.gov/…/sevp-modifies-temporary-exemptions-no…

HKDC - Hong Kong Democracy Council US is monitoring closely how and if this temporary rule will be implemented. We are in close contact with federal and state officials, as well as universities and colleges to discuss potential harm and negative impact to students and schools and how we can work together to ensure no student will be forced to abandon their academic pursuits in the US or be forced to travel back home during a global pandemic.

Support our work: www.gogetfunding.com/hkdc

If you are a foreign student from Hong Kong and you are concerned about how this change might impact you or know someone who could be impacted, please email students@hkdc.us with your name, email and phone number, and university/college you are attending.

HKDC - Hong Kong Democracy Council US will be hosting online informational sessions in the coming days to try to answer your questions and to share about steps you can take individually and collectively to ensure that no one is forced to leave the US because of the pandemic.

We stand with US-Hong Kong students

https://www.facebook.com/105804624116745/posts/301858954511310/?d=n
